course.subject: MARK
course.name: Consumerism and Happiness
course.description: Historical, cultural, psychological and economic perspectives on consumerism; the role of advertising and branding in influencing self-identity and consumerism; money, materialism, and happiness; managing personal finances.

reviews.author: sebastian
reviews.title: The Shopping Classs
reviews.comment_content: Super fun and interesting and great for personal growth. It is super rare for a class to talk about the negatives of shopping and shopping in general.
reviews.comment_teaching: Great teacher, funny and amusing. Honestly one of best teachers and mentors at UST. Also creates great discussions
reviews.comment_grading: All grades are weighted. the class is senior heavy and hence will have many A students. This means that your grades will not be as high as expected.
reviews.comment_workload: Work load can be hard. There are 2 projects and 2 finals. It can be hard depending on when you get your projects and exams assigned.

reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Salvacruz is a very engaging and enthusiastic professor. He explains the concepts very well and tries to make us think critically about how marketing and consumption influences our well-being and happiness. He encourages students to speak up and contribute their thoughts/opinions in class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Short quiz/attendance - 10%
Case Analysis/Topical Report - 8%
Group Project (Presentation + Written Report) - 25%
Term Test 1 - 25%
Term Test 2 - 25%
Personal Reflection - 5%
Research Credit - 2%

In-Class Activities/Short quiz/attendance:
Participation is an important part of this course, so be sure to speak up as much as you can. In-class activities are typically very easy and can be done in a short amount of time. There was only 1 quiz this semester. It had 5 questions which were pretty straightforward.

Case Analysis/Topical Report: You will be assigned a topic/case and do a presentation with your group.

Group Project (Presentation + Written Report)
You choose 1 of the 3 options:
1. Spending Diary
2. Counter-advertisement/social marketing program (make a print ad or video)
3. Research/Discussion Paper
All groups must do an oral presentation and written report as part of the group project.

Term Test 1 & 2:
Tests are not cumulative. The tests had 30 MC questions with 2 long-answer questions. The MC questions are pretty straightforward if you are familiar with class content.

Research Credit:
Make sure to check your email and sign up for studies ASAP! Otherwise you need to do 2 written assignments instead.

I participated regularly in lectures and did all in-class activities. My scores for Test 1 and 2 were both more than 0.7sd above mean. The scores for the Case Analysis/Topical Report and Group Project were not released.
Grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload: The workload for this course is heavy. The Case Analysis/Topical Report and Group Project (presentation + report) are time consuming and require you to work well with your group mates.

reviews.author: Mina
reviews.comment_content: The content are some basic and interesting marketing concepts through case analysis and reading. Don't needa worry that this is the first time u take marketing course.
reviews.comment_teaching: He would like to adopt case analysis and real life example to illustrate the marketing concept so it is quite easy to understand.
reviews.comment_grading: His grading system is quite fair as the exam are pretty easy with all MC illustrated before on the ppt. The essay question is also easy to elaborate and answer. Attendance is taken in the beginning of the class for every lesson.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is considerable as there is reading review before every class and the group project has occupied a heavy percentile in the whole course.

reviews.author: apita
reviews.title: Easy scoring course
reviews.comment_content: Very easy and basic content. It is quite interesting and makes you wonder.
reviews.comment_teaching: Salvacruz is a really fun man. He makes the class super interesting and learning becomes really fun.
reviews.comment_grading: Super easy grading. I didn't work way too hard but I still ended up with an A grade.
reviews.comment_workload: The work load can be quite high in the starting when there are huge chunks of pages you need to read. But with time, it gets better, especially if you have a good team. you get to decide your team so think carefully.

reviews.author: Deby
reviews.comment_content: The content of this course is quite interesting as it challenges your thoughts about today's advertising and all forms of things that caused consumerism. There are a lot of in class discussions and you have to participate actively as you will be given one card per one question you answered. The number of cards you have at the end of the semester will determine your participation score.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Dennis Tan LIM is very funny and likeable. He really makes the learning environment interesting. He also shares stories about his personal life.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm 24%
Final 24%
Group project & presentation 24%
Graded assignments/quizzes 10%
Case analysis report 8%
Class participation 8% (includes attendance, prs questions, in class discussion)
Research credit 2%

I think it is quite hard to get an A since everyone is very active in class and he is relatively generous in giving scores for exams so the scores do not differ much.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload for this course is too heavy: 5 assignments during the whole semester, 1 midterm, 1 final exam, 1 group case analysis, 1 group project & presentation.
